definitions.definition: (obsolete outside Britain and Australia) A man, a fellow.
A cleft, crack, or chink, as in the surface of the earth, or in the skin.
A division; a breach, as in a party.
Of the skin, to split or flake due to cold weather or dryness.
To cause to open in slits or chinks; to split; to cause the skin of to crack or become rough.
One of the jaws or cheeks of a vice, etc.
(authorship) One of the main sections into which the text of a book is divided.
definitions.example: Detective novel writers try to keep up the suspense until the last chapter.

definitions.definition: A section of a social or religious body.
A sequence (of events), especially when presumed related and likely to continue.
Protective leather leggings attached at the waist.
definitions.example: Chaps were a costume staple of Westerns.
